data: NICU Initial Seizure Management (Module)
Patient Care
Seizure Observation Record
T;N
Amplitude Integrated EEG - Bedside
T;N
If neurovital signs required, please select NICU Neurological Assessment (Neurovital Signs) (Module)
Medications
Initial Loading Dose
LORazepam
0.1 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
midazolam
200 mcg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
150 mcg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
100 mcg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
phenobarbital
20 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
phenobarbital
10 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
phenytoin
20 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
levETIRAcetam
40 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
60 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
Consider pyriDOXine 50 mg dosing in SGA or preterm infants
pyriDOXine
100 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
50 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
Maintenance Dose
phenobarbital
5 mg/kg, IV, qdaily, drug form: inj
phenobarbital
5 mg/kg, PO, qdaily, drug form: oral liq
5 mg/kg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab
phenytoin
2.5 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, drug form: inj
phenytoin
2.5 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: oral liq
levETIRAcetam
20 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, drug form: inj
30 mg/kg, IV, q12h interval, drug form: inj
levETIRAcetam
20 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: oral liq
30 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: oral liq
pyriDOXine
50 mg, IV, qdaily, drug form: inj
100 mg, IV, qdaily, drug form: inj
pyriDOXine
50 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: oral liq
100 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: oral liq
leucovorin
1.5 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: oral liq
2.5 mg/kg, PO, q12h interval, drug form: oral liq
For continuous medication infusions, confirm with bedside nurse or clinical pharmacist if unsure which volume to select. Choose 3 mL syringe for infusion rate less than 0.1 mL per hour
Suggested starting continuous midazolam infusion rate is 60 to 120 mcg/kg/h, with a maximum of 900 mcg/kg/h. Increase by 60 to 120 mcg/kg/h q15min
midazolam NEO continuous infusion (200 mcg/mL) in D5W 25 mL
120 mcg/kg/h, IV
5 mg, 120 mcg/kg/h
midazolam NEO continuous infusion (200 mcg/mL) in D5W 3 mL
120 mcg/kg/h, IV
0.6 mg, 120 mcg/kg/h
midazolam NEO titratable infusion (200 mcg/mL) in D5W 25 mL
None
titrate, IV, minimum rate: 0 mcg/kg/h, maximum rate: 70 mcg/kg/h
midazolam NEO titratable infusion (200 mcg/mL) in D5W 3 mL
None
titrate, IV, minimum rate: 0 mcg/kg/h, maximum rate: 70 mcg/kg/h
Laboratory
phenobarbital Peak Draw Instructions
Draw level 1 hour after the end of the loading dose
phenobarbital Trough Draw Instructions
Draw level prior to 3rd maintenance dose (preferably, just before dose is given)
phenytoin Peak Draw Instructions
Draw level 1 hour after the end of the loading dose
phenytoin Trough Draw Instructions
Draw level prior to 3rd maintenance dose (preferably, just before dose is given)

Consult Biochemical Medicine (Metabolics) for further testing
Diagnostic Tests
NEURO Electroencephalogram
Scheduling Priority: Within 24 hours, Reason For Exam: new onset seizures, Schedule as: Inpatient, Scheduling Locations: BCH EEG EMG, Portable
NEURO Intensive Video and Electroencephalogram Monitoring (IM/EMU)

Scheduling Priority: Within 24 hours, Reason For Exam: new onset seizures, Schedule as: Inpatient, Scheduling Locations: BCH EEG EMG, After discussion with staff neonatologist and neurologist, Portable
MRI Head and Spectroscopy w/o Contrast
Urgent

Urgent

Urgent

Consults/Referrals
Consider consultation with Neurology and Biochemical Medicine (Metabolics). All physician to physician consults require a phone call
Non Categorized
If requiring stroke-related orders, select NICU Suspected Neonatal Stroke (Module) or NICU Confirmed Neonatal Stroke (Module)
